title: Baked Kale Chips
description: A Healthy alternative to traditional chips, packed with Vitamins and Fiber.
steps: Preheat oven to 150°C (300°F).
Wash and dry kale, remove stems, tear leaves into bite-sized pieces.
Toss with olive oil and salt.
Spread evenly on a baking sheet.
Bake for 10–15 minutes until crisp.

title: Baked Banana Chips
description: Protein-packed quinoa with fresh vegetables and tangy dressing
steps: Preheat oven to 120°C (250°F).
Slice bananas thinly and brush with lemon juice
Lightly coat a baking sheet with coconut oil.
Arrange slices evenly and bake for 2–3 hours, flipping halfway.
Cool before serving.

title: Baked Salmon With Veggies
description: Oven-baked salmon fillet with a medley of roasted vegetables.
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (broccoli, carrots, bell peppers)
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place salmon on a baking sheet, drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice, season with salt and pepper.
Add vegetables around the salmon.
Bake for 15–20 minutes until salmon is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Serve hot.

title: Fruit and Yogurt Parfait
description: Layers of fresh fruits, Greek yogurt, and granola for a wholesome and tasty snack.
ingredients: ½ cup mixed fruits (berries, banana, mango)
steps: Layer yogurt, fruits, and granola in a glass.
Repeat layers if desired and serve immediately.

title: Egg White Omelette
description: Light, Fluffy, and Protein-Loaded.It's a healthy choice for breakfast or a post-workout meal.
ingredients: 1 tsp olive oil or cooking spray
Salt and black pepper to taste
steps: In a bowl, whisk egg whites (and milk if using) until slightly frothy.
Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Sauté onions, peppers, and spinach for 2–3 minutes.
Pour egg whites into the pan, spreading evenly.
Cook until edges firm up, then gently fold in half.
Cook another 1–2 minutes and serve hot.

title: Berry Chia Pudding
description: A healthy and delicious dessert packed with antioxidants and omega-3s
ingredients: 1 cup almond milk (or any milk of choice)
steps: In a bowl or jar, combine chia seeds, almond milk, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
Whisk well to combine, making sure there are no clumps of chia seeds.
Stir in the mixed berries.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight, until the mixture has thickened to a pudding-like consistency.
Stir the pudding before serving to ensure even consistency.
Top with additional fresh berries and chopped nuts if desired.
Serve cold.

title: Lemon-Tahini Dressing
description: A tangy and creamy dressing made with tahini, lemon juice, and garlic.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
steps: Whisk tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and water in a bowl until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper.
Adjust consistency with extra water if needed.

title: Mixed Nuts
description: A healthy handful of mixed nuts providing protein, healthy fats, and fiber.
steps: Mix all nuts in a bowl.
Serve as a snack or store in an airtight container.

title: Green Goddess Salad
description: A flavorful salad with green veggies, avocado, and a creamy dressing.
steps: Combine greens, avocado, and cucumber in a bowl.
Drizzle with Green Goddess dressing.
Season with salt and pepper and toss gently.

title: Green Detox Smoothie
description: A nutrient-packed smoothie with spinach, kale, and green fruits for a detox boost.
steps: Place all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Serve immediately for best freshness.

title: Papaya Fruit Bowl
description: A refreshing bowl of ripe papaya, drizzled with lime juice and topped with seeds or nuts.
ingredients: 1 tsp chia seeds or pumpkin seeds (optional)
steps: Place papaya cubes in a bowl.
Drizzle with lime juice.
Sprinkle seeds or nuts if desired and serve.

title: Almond Flour Cookies
description: Gluten-free, chewy cookies made with almond flour and natural sweeteners.
ingredients: ¼ cup honey or maple syrup
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet.
Mix almond flour, baking soda, and salt.
Whisk egg, honey, vanilla, and coconut oil in a separate bowl.
Combine wet and dry ingredients to form dough.
Scoop dough onto baking sheet and flatten slightly.
Bake 12–15 minutes until edges are golden. Cool before serving.

title: Avocado Dip
description: A creamy and nutritious dip made with avocado, lime, and seasonings.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
steps: Mash avocados in a bowl.
Add lime juice, garlic, cilantro, salt, and pepper.
Mix until creamy and smooth.
Serve immediately with chips or veggies.

title: Beef and Veggie Stir-Fry
description: A savory and quick stir-fry made with lean beef and colorful vegetables.
steps: Heat sesame oil in a wok over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add beef slices and cook until browned.
Toss in broccoli, peppers, and carrots.
Add soy sauce and stir-fry for another 3–4 minutes.
Serve hot with or without rice.

title: Black Bean and Quinoa Chili
description: A protein-packed vegetarian chili with black beans, quinoa, and spices.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot and sauté onions, garlic, and peppers.
Add chili powder and stir for 1 minute.
Mix in black beans, diced tomatoes, and quinoa.
Simmer for 15 minutes until flavors combine.
Serve hot with optional toppings like avocado or cheese.

title: Honey Mustard Dressing
description: A sweet and tangy dressing made with honey, mustard, and yogurt.
steps: In a bowl, whisk together mustard, honey, yogurt, and vinegar.
Season with salt and pepper.
Chill for 10 minutes before serving.

title: Veggie Pasta Primavera
description: A colorful pasta dish packed with seasonal vegetables and light olive oil sauce.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
steps: Cook pasta according to package instructions.
In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté garlic.
Add broccoli, zucchini, and bell peppers; cook until tender-crisp.
Toss vegetables with pasta and season with salt and pepper.
Serve with grated Parmesan if desired.

title: Paneer Salad Bowl
description: A refreshing salad bowl with grilled paneer, greens, and a tangy dressing.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
steps: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a pan and grill paneer cubes until golden.
In a bowl, combine greens, cucumber, and tomatoes.
Add grilled paneer and drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.

title: Zucchini Bread
description: A moist and healthy quick bread made with fresh zucchini and warm spices.
ingredients: ½ cup honey or maple syrup
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a loaf pan.
Mix dry ingredients (flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon) in a bowl.
In another bowl, whisk eggs, honey, and olive oil.
Fold in zucchini and then combine with dry ingredients.
Pour batter into pan and bake for 50–60 minutes.
Cool before slicing and serving.

title: Lentil Curry
description: A hearty lentil curry simmered with tomatoes, spices, and herbs.
steps: Heat olive oil and sauté onion and garlic until soft.
Add tomatoes and spices; cook 2–3 minutes.
Add lentils and 2 cups water; simmer until lentils are tender.
Serve hot with rice or bread.

title: Tomato Cucumber Salad
description: A refreshing and simple salad with tomatoes, cucumbers, and a light vinaigrette.
steps: Combine tomatoes and cucumber in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Season with salt, pepper, and herbs. Toss gently and serve.

title: Summer Corn Salad With Asparagus
description: A light and crisp summer salad with sweet corn, asparagus, and a lemony dressing.
steps: Blanch asparagus until tender-crisp.
Combine corn and asparagus in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

title: Carrot and Celery Sticks with Hummus
description: Crisp carrot and celery sticks served with creamy hummus for a healthy and satisfying snack.
steps: Wash and cut carrots and celery into sticks.
Serve with hummus as a dipping sauce.

title: Tuna Avocado Salad
description: A refreshing and creamy salad with tuna, avocado, and fresh veggies.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
steps: In a bowl, mash avocado with lemon juice.
Add tuna, cucumber, and onion.
Mix gently with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Serve chilled or with whole-grain bread.

title: Classic Hummus
description: A creamy Middle Eastern dip made with chickpeas, tahini, garlic, and lemon.
steps: Add chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and olive oil to a food processor.
Blend until smooth, adding water if needed for consistency.
Season with salt and serve with pita or veggies.

title: Spinach and Cheese Stuffed Peppers
description: Bell peppers stuffed with spinach, cheese, and herbs, baked to perfection.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Mix spinach, ricotta, mozzarella, oregano, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Stuff each bell pepper half with the mixture.
Place peppers on a baking tray, drizzle with olive oil.
Bake for 20–25 minutes until peppers are tender and cheese is melted.

title: Greek Yogurt Ranch
description: A healthy twist on ranch dressing using Greek yogurt, herbs, and garlic.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
steps: Mix yogurt, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, dill, and parsley in a bowl.
Season with salt and pepper.
Chill for 20 minutes before serving.

title: Vegetable Soup
description: A comforting soup with mixed vegetables simmered in a light broth.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot and sauté onion and garlic.
Add carrots, beans, and cabbage; cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in vegetable broth and simmer for 15–20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.

title: Chicken Salad with Yogurt Dressing
description: A creamy and healthy chicken salad made with Greek yogurt instead of mayo.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
steps: In a bowl, mix Greek yogurt, lemon juice, and Dijon mustard.
Add chicken, celery, and grapes to the mixture.
Stir until well combined.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve chilled as a salad or sandwich filling.

title: Salsa Fresca
description: A fresh and zesty tomato-based salsa with onions, cilantro, and lime.
steps: Combine tomatoes, onion, jalapeño, and cilantro in a bowl.
Add lime juice and salt.
Mix well and refrigerate for 15 minutes before serving.

title: Oatmeal Banana Muffins
description: Moist and hearty muffins made with ripe bananas, oats, and a touch of honey.
ingredients: ¼ cup olive oil or melted coconut oil
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a muffin tin.
Mix dry ingredients (flour, oats, baking soda, salt, cinnamon).
In another bowl, whisk eggs, honey, and oil. Add mashed bananas.
Combine wet and dry ingredients and mix gently.
Spoon batter into muffin cups and bake 20–25 minutes.
Cool before serving.

title: Mango Banana Smoothie
description: A creamy smoothie made with ripe mango, banana, and a touch of honey.
steps: Place all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Serve immediately.

title: Grilled Chicken with Quinoa
description: Tender grilled chicken served with fluffy quinoa and a side of vegetables.
steps: Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
Season chicken with salt, pepper, and paprika.
Grill chicken until fully cooked.
Sauté mixed vegetables in olive oil for 3–4 minutes.
Serve grilled chicken on a bed of quinoa with vegetables on the side.

title: Green Salad
description: A simple and refreshing salad with various green leaves and a light vinaigrette.
steps: Combine mixed greens and cucumber in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

title: Energy Balls (Dates and Oats)
description: No-bake energy balls made with dates, oats, and a touch of honey for a quick boost.
steps: Blend dates in a food processor until smooth.
Mix with oats and nut butter until a sticky dough forms.
Roll into small balls and refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving.

title: Watermelon Mint Salad
description: A refreshing summer salad combining sweet watermelon cubes with fresh mint leaves.
steps: Combine watermelon cubes and mint in a bowl.
Drizzle with lime juice and sprinkle a pinch of salt if desired.
Toss gently and serve chilled.

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
description: Quick and colorful stir-fried vegetables in a light soy-ginger sauce.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté ginger briefly.
Add all vegetables and stir-fry for 5–7 minutes until tender-crisp.
Add soy sauce and toss to coat.
Serve immediately as a main or side dish.

title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
description: Bell peppers filled with a flavorful mix of rice, beans, and vegetables, baked to perfection.
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Mix cooked rice, beans, corn, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Stuff bell pepper halves with the mixture.
Place in a baking dish and bake for 20–25 minutes.
Serve hot.

title: Lower-Fat Coleslaw
description: A lighter version of classic coleslaw made with a yogurt-based dressing.
steps: Mix cabbage and carrot in a bowl.
Add yogurt, vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Toss until well combined and serve chilled.

title: Sweet Potato Curry
description: A creamy curry made with sweet potatoes, coconut milk, and spices.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot and sauté onion and garlic.
Add curry powder and stir for 30 seconds.
Add sweet potatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk, cover, and simmer until sweet potatoes are tender.
Season with salt before serving.

title: Whole Wheat Bread
description: A classic loaf made with 100% whole wheat flour, perfect for sandwiches.
steps: In a bowl, combine warm water, yeast, and honey. Let sit 5–10 minutes until frothy.
Mix in flour, salt, and olive oil to form a dough.
Knead dough for 8–10 minutes until smooth.
Let dough rise for 1–2 hours until doubled in size.
Shape into a loaf and place in a greased loaf pan.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 30–35 minutes until golden.

title: Pineapple Coconut Smoothie
description: A tropical blend of pineapple and coconut milk, perfect for a refreshing treat.
steps: Add all ingredients to a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Serve chilled.
